questions.text: Are you considered to be a medium to large enterprise according to the definition Commission Recommendation 2003/361/EC (for example, employ more than 50 people, enjoy a turnover and/or annual balance sheet total of more than 10 million Euros)?

options.explanation: If no, then most likely NIS2 does not apply to you, since this size cap rule has been introduced. There are several exceptions detailed in Article 2(2) of the Directive.

questions.text: Are you currently defined as a critical entity, based on the EU Directive on the resilience of critical entities (CER)?

options.explanation: For the sake of this Directive, a critical entity is considered of particular European significance if it provides an essential service to six or more member states.

questions.text: Do you provide any of the following services?

options.text: Trust services covered by Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 ('eIDAS Regulation')
options.explanation: If yes, then NIS2 applies to you unless these services are used exclusively within closed systems resulting from national law or from agreements between a defined set of participants.

options.text: Data center services such as storage, processing, transportation, operate IT and network equipment (for example as a Managed Services Provider), with facilities and infrastructure for power distribution and environmental control?
options.explanation: If this is the case, but you are not classified as per the cloud service definition according to ISO/IEC 17788:2014, then yes, NIS2 applies to you.

options.text: Manufacturing of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations
options.explanation: If yes: Annex I of the directive specifies what sub-sectors in health are covered.

options.text: Top-level-domain (TLD) name servers, publicly available recursive domain name resolution services for Internet end-users, and authoritative domain name resolution services (DNS)?
Services in one of the steps of the postal delivery chain: clearance, sorting or distribution, and pick-up service?
Public electronic communications networks or publicly available electronic communications services?

questions.text: Are you part of any of the following industries?

options.text: Manufacturing of goods such as medical devices, machinery and motor vehicles
options.explanation: If yes: Annex I of the directive specifies what sub-sectors in manufacturing are covered.
If yes: the EU Digital Operational Resilience Act (DORA) requirements still takes precedence over NIS 2 (lex specialis).
